title.narrative: Output 1: Targeted Government Institution capacities strengthened for accountability, transparency, and provision of equitable and quality services and citizen expectations for voice, development, the rule of law and accountability are met by stronger sys

Output 1: Targeted Government Institution capacities strengthened for accountability, transparency, and provision of equitable and quality services and citizen expectations for voice, development, the rule of law and accountability are met by stronger sys

target.value:
Targets 2018: (a) Prioritised areas for security and justice sector institutional level transformation identified.
(b) Targeted government security and justice institutions have initiated the implementation of their plans for institutional transformation
(c) Improved feelings of safety and security amongst target populations both in terms of quality

actual.value:
(a) Eight priority areas for security and justice sector institutional level transformation was identifed (b) During the reporting period in synocrity with target (a) above following targeted government security and justice institutions have initiated the implementation of their plans for institutional transformation
(c) strong majority across the country felt safe in 2018 (89%) compared to those who felt safe in 2016 ( 48%) . Propotion of population satisfied with their last experience of security and justice service delivery: security sector 41% and justice sector 39%

target.value:
(a) type and nature of improved security and justice institutional capacities that contributes to stronger systems of democratic governance
(b) % of people that feel their expectations for accountable, transparent and quality security and justice services are met

actual.value: Partially achieved (a) Eight priority areas for security and justice sector institutional level transformation were identified (b) Based on stakeholder feedback on level of expectations being met on security sector service delivery. Very Satisfied 30%, Satisfied 52%, Dissatisfied 12%, Very Dissatisfied 6%. Based on stakeholder feedback on level expectations being met on justice sector service delivery. Very Satisfied 24%, Satisfied 54%, Dissatisfied 15%, Very Dissatisfied 7%

title.narrative: Percentage of people that feel their expectations for accountable, transparent and quality security and justice services have met.
Percentage of people that feel their expectations for accountable, transparent and quality security and justice services have met.

target.value: Improved feelings of safety and security amongst target populations both in terms of quality of service delivery and access to security and justice services.

actual.value: Additionally. activities to enhance local police capacity to deliver reasonable security services at local level was also undertaken in collaboration with the MoI i.e. training and mentoring on Improving the Effectiveness of Local Police Service -IELP. On 7 February 2018 the Parliament endorsed the SDC by-laws. which will better position the SDC to play an active role in democratic oversight and to improve partnership between the legislature and the executive in security sector oversight.

target.value: No priority areas for security and justice institutional strengthening identified. A Government endorsed and led SSRP is in place to guide the identification of the priority areas.People at large feel that their expectations for accountable. transparent and quality security and justice services have not being met.

actual.value: No priority areas for security and justice institutional strengthening identified. A Government endorsed and led SSRP is in place to guide the identification of the priority areas.People at large feel that their expectations for accountable. transparent and quality security and justice services have not being met.

title.narrative: Type and nature of improved security and justice institutional capacities that contributes to stronger systems of democratic governance.
Type and nature of improved security and justice institutional capacities that contributes to stronger systems of democratic governance.

target.value: Prioritised areas for security and justice sector institutional level transformation identified. Targeted government security and justice institutions have initiated the implementation of their plans for institutional transformation.

actual.value: In outline. priorities for SSRP implementation has been identified and the implementation plan was further refined by the SSR Committee with advice and assistance from UNDP. MoI and Higher Judicial Council (HJC) have taken appropriate steps to initiate the implementation of their institutional reform plans with support from UNDP (e.g. Local Police Road Map and Criminal Investigation SoP).

target.value: engagementer. som hører under vores stabiliseringsprogram for Syrien & Irak 2016-2018 fremgår røde dvs. no-targets linked. hvilket undrer mig.

actual.value: No priority areas for security and justice institutional strengthening identified. A Government endorsed and led SSRP is in place to guide the identification of the priority areas.People at large feel that their expectations for accountable. transparent and quality security and justice services have not being met.
